channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Changing what works to what scales
item.description: Tech is shifting faster than the models we built our impact on. And that means even thriving nonprofits face a choice: Keep optimizing what works—or r...

item.title: The ‘bike bus’ movement has taken over one New Jersey town, with hundreds biking to school each day: ‘People naturally gravitate to something that’s super joyful’
item.description: What began as a handful of parents hoping to encourage their kids to bike to school has grown into a weekly ritual for the township.

item.title: For Gen Z, it’s ‘not enough to work hard’ if you want to succeed, says Jamie Dimon—specific skills are the way to get ahead
item.description: "In the old days, you could be in 10th grade, go get a factory in Detroit, and eventually you could afford a family, a home, a car, and that may not b...

item.title: American Airlines layoffs: Support and management job cuts add to corporate staff reductions in 2025
item.description: As the longest federal government shutdown in U.S. history drags on, federal workers are left in financial limbo—and the airline industry is feeling t...

item.title: How Your Brand Can Win the Holiday Gift Guide Game in 2025
item.description: Getting your brand’s products featured in gift guides can boost your holiday sales. These strategies can help you nab placement.

item.title: Human stories break through
item.description: Over the last two years, the value of content has collapsed. Thanks to the LLM revolution, the internet is drowning in an avalanche of indistinguishab...

item.title: Trump admits the GOP was blindsided by economy fears as Democrats sweep key races: ‘Republicans don’t talk about the word affordability’
item.description: "We have the greatest economy right now. A lot of people don’t see that," Trump said.

item.title: 5 Marketing Tactics to Turn Customers Into Evangelists—Without a Big Budget
item.description: CEOs of Inc. 5000 companies Empify and Wisp explain how to build bonds with customers, and make them your best advocates.

item.title: Gen-Z Talks About Their Salaries Openly. Should Your Company Embrace Pay Transparency?
item.description: Some countries have laws mandating salaries be public knowledge. The U.S. plays by different workplace rules, but things might be changing.

item.title: Anxious generation author warns Gen z’s brains are ‘growing around their phones’ the way a tree warps around a tombstone
item.description: Speaking at a Dartmouth symposium on mental health, NYU professor Jonathan Haidt discussed his research on “the Great Rewiring.”

item.title: Another AI Winter Is Coming—But This One Will Be Different
item.description: Right now we are in an AI summer. It’s possible we’re heading toward an AI winter. But that doesn’t mean the end of AI.

item.title: The pope hates it. Norway hates it. Elon Musk calls them ‘corporate terrorists.’ Welcome to Tesla’s trillion-dollar showdown
item.description: “He frequently teeters on the edge of disaster," said Tesla owner and money manager Nancy Tengler, "and then pulls back just in the nick of time.”

item.title: Qatar Airways is selling its stake in Cathay Pacific for $896 million
item.description: Qatar Airways will sell its stake in Hong Kong-based Cathay Pacific Airways in a share buyback valued at $896 million, the companies announced, ending...

item.title: Your Staff Are Hiding Their Menopause Symptoms. Here’s How You Can Help
item.description: An open, supportive company culture may help many women feel safer about discussing their experiences.

item.title: ‘Woke is back’ on social media following Mamdani victory
item.description: New York City has elected a democratic socialist as its next mayor. Across the internet, progressive internet users are hopescrolling for the first ti...
